title: Primary held when; candidates only those nominated
context: §12-2 Primary held when; candidates only those nominated. The primary shall be held on the second Saturday of August in every even numbered year. No person shall be a candidate for any general or special general election unless the person has been nominated in the immediately preceding primary or special primary. [L 1970, c 26, pt of §2; am L 1973, c 217, §2(a); am L 1975, c 36, §2(1); am L 1976, c 106, §2(1); am L 1979, c 122, §2; gen ch 1985; am L 2010, c 126, §2] Case Notes Court abstained from deciding whether Hawaii statute bans write-in voting. 846 F.2d 587. Casting of write-in votes not permitted. 70 H. 498, 776 P.2d 824.
